dmca.title: [ABUSE] to Peter Pathos]
dmca.body:
nc 

-----Original Message-----
From: The Planet Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Tuesday, May 10, 2005 9:04 AM
To: legal@theplanet.com
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] to Peter Pathos]

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Forwarding to Legal for review.

- -------- Original Message --------
Subject:         [ABUSE] to Peter Pathos
Date:         Sun, 08 May 2005 19:26:16 +0000
From:         imrannanji nanji <nanji_imrannanji@hotmail.com>
To:         abuse@theplanet.com



to Mr. Peter Pathos,

Hi there my name Is Imran Nanji and im a servicing manager for def jam
records. And currently we are on the prowl for people who have illegal music
access abilities or are in support of this. We have reviewed a site knows as
www.crazypellas.co.uk <http://www.crazypellas.co.uk/> which is under your
web hosting services plans. the ip address we traced www.crazypellas.co.uk
<http://www.crazypellas.co.uk/> was to this server ip 67.18.240.18
(NETBLK-THEPLANET-BLK-11) If you didnt know the RIAA is highly against any
internet address that violates digital music access rtight protocols. this
site has although has no music filed stored on there servers which are
registered under your web hosting, they are housing thousands of download
links in order for internet users to obtain music in a highly non legal
manner off of 3rd party servers. we wish for you to advise the resigstrant
of this site as well your adimistrator. In addition this is a criminal
liability and all individuals who are in suspicion of illegal digital music
liabilities are forced to submit there information to the RIAA for further
review.
Therefore it is neccessary that you submit us the contact information of
registrant of www.crazypellas.co.uk <http://www.crazypellas.co.uk/> thank
you.



- --
Thanks,
Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/aup/
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----
Version: GnuPG v1.2.5 (MingW32)
Comment: Using GnuPG with Thunderbird - http://enigmail.mozdev.org

iD8DBQFCgL9mvK/XpJs6oyURAh32AJ41gOFbAyL0z4JZwbhZtL/94BfLjQCgkchb
6YI+n4aAMBZbdf0EgWtnUwY=
=KyAw
-----END PGP SIGNATURE-----
